content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    # Find all Julia code blocks
    code_blocks = findall(r"^```jl\n(.*)\n```\n", md, count=1)

    # If no code blocks found, return empty string
    if isempty(code_blocks)
        return ""
    end

    # Extract code and remove fences
    extracted_codes = String[]
    for block in code_blocks
        code = match(r"(.+)"), block)[1]
        extracted_codes .= code * "\n"
    end

    # Join the extracted codes together with a newline
    joined_code = join(extracted_codes, "\n"))

    return joined_code
end
```

Now you can use this function in your Julia script:

```julia
md_file = "path_to_your_markdown_file.md"
extracted_code = extract_julia_code(md_file)
println(extracted_code)
```

This will print the extracted Julia code from the given markdown file.
